column5: made it up to my uncles place for the first time this year. i was hoping to go up on opener but with work and plans falling through with a few friends i finally made it up. hit the road thursday night after i got off work and got up there at about 230 am only to be greeted by a tree laying across the driveway. with my friends car not being too offroad friendly i ended up breaking off many of the branches and holding the tree back while he drove through to the cottage. we unpacked our stuff then got some sleep. got up the next morning to do some shore fishing but only had one solid hit which shook it off. finally at around noon we had a boat set up and in the water and we were set for fishing all weekend. it ended up being one of the best weekends i've had up there. i caught quite a few fish and my friend (not much of an angler) caught his first of 2 species.  the fish tally  friday i caught 12 walleye. my friend caught his first ever pike  saturday i beat my previous day by catching 16 walleye and 1 smallie. my friend managed to catch his second ever pike.  sunday i managed another 16 walleye 2 smallies and 1 pike. and after losing 2 boatside my friend caught his first ever walleye and he was really happy  monday i slept in and only got out for 2 hours before heading out but i managed another 3 walleye with one being my pb at 4lbs 10 ozs which beat my previous pb by only 5ozs haha  time for some pics  his first ever pike   fish for the evening fry   view from the upstairs bedroom   lounging around   average size walleye of the trip   evening view while fishin   his second ever pike   overcast morning   on my way   another average walleye   my pike   failed picture attempt   first ever walleye   the cottage/house   good current holding fish   bay on the smaller river   and finally my new pb walleye
Right on miller nice to see you get into so many Eyes!
very nice report thanks for sharing  I sure do love the shots of the river its self that area looks amazing
Awesome report miller Some first ones ever and pbs One thing I do know, its not hard to get someone hooked on fishing, esp if its their first time at the technique
thanks guys. mike p. i love the scenery up there, i have a few other pictures and a few from last year that i'll post if i can find them.
Looks like a fantastic weekend.  What a great view.  Well done.
Nice Report Miller. Looks like a great trip.
That place looks spectacular. Nice cottage and great fishing too. Congrats !
cell shots            couple shots from last year
I can't wait to shore fish the Mag this summer... Next time I drive to Parry Sound it'll be a 5 hr drive.  Great report Miller, walleye master you are.
great report... keep em coming
Where abouts (general area) on the Mag. It is a long twisty river.
Great report and pics.  That cabin looks awesome.  Congrats on the PB
Nice job on the eyes
That's a fantastic weekend...love the pics!  I should really fish the Magnetewan more often....not too far from my parent's place.  Are you closer to hwy 11 or 69?
Wow, you guys slayed 'em!  Awesome report.  Nice shots
great pics love the mag river, congrats on the personal best.
Little piece of heaven up there. Great pics and report.

Hey man, awesome report.  Gotta luv the Mag.  Congrats to your personal best Pickerel!  Good job!  I was fishing the western waters this past weekend and it was brutally buggy.  You guys were super fortunate that the flies didn't buzz your pictures out of focus!  Great report and a nice piece of paradise for sure
barely dealt with any bugs. only in the evening time. during the day it was hott enough that they weren't out just a few random horseflies.
love the scenery shots, i grew up by a river and that brought back some fond memories...thanks for sharing
great report!!  some good looking fish you guys got into!!  cheers!
I was thinking that Simon, I grew up right beside a river and was within 20 mins drive (an hour by bicycle) of 3 or 4 others. Miss river fishing a lot.
